</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=455 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>Notes:</B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Mr.&#160;Pannell was appointed to
    the Board on February&#160;27, 2008 and was appointed to the
    CG&#038;N and HR&#038;C Committees on May&#160;7, 2008.
    Mr.&#160;Pannell advised the Board in advance of his appointment
    of certain scheduling conflicts. Mr.&#160;Pannell&#146;s Board
    and Committee attendance is based on the applicable Board and
    Committee meetings which occurred after the date of his
    appointment and for which he did not have prior identified
    commitments.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Mr.&#160;Wilson is not a member of
    any Committee, but attended all Committee meetings (other than
    <I>in camera </I>sessions of the independent directors held at
    all Board and Committee meetings).
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<A name='123'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">BOARD
    MATTERS</FONT></U></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<A name='124'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Board
    Orientation and Continuing Education</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The CG&#038;N Committee is responsible for the orientation and
    continuing education of new directors. The expectations of a new
    director on our Board, including specific responsibilities,
    Committee appointments, workload and time commitments, are
    reviewed in advance with potential Board candidates. Such
    candidates are also provided with a copy of our Directors&#146;
    manual (the &#147;<B>Manual</B>&#148;) prior to joining our
    Board which includes, among other items, our Terms of Reference
    for individual directors, Board and Committee Charters, the
    Guidelines, our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, as well as
    extensive information relating to the Corporation and our
    industry. Prior to joining the Board, new directors are provided
    with copies of our corporate governance documents, together with
    certain corporate policies, recent analysts&#146; reports and
    press releases, and various company and industry brochures.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Each new director attends a comprehensive orientation at which
    members of senior management review our business, corporate
    strategy, financial profile, governance systems, culture, and
    current key issues. The orientation also affords an opportunity
    to review the Manual provided to new directors to facilitate
    further discussion regarding the role of the Board, its
    Committees and their members in the context of our business
    operations. Upon accepting a position on our Board, a new
    director is required to acknowledge his or her commitment to
    comply with our Code of
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    14
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Business Conduct and Ethics. New directors have the opportunity
    to meet individually with members of senior management, and all
    directors have regular access to management personnel to discuss
    matters of interest.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Continuing education is provided through a number of methods,
    including visits to our sites and facilities (which all of our
    directors are encouraged to attend to familiarize themselves
    with our business and to become acquainted with senior plant
    personnel and high potential employees), an annual comprehensive
    dedicated off-site strategy session, presentations from
    management, employees and outside experts to the Board and its
    Committees on topics of interest and developing issues within
    their respective responsibilities, and ongoing distribution of
    relevant information. The CG&#038;N Committee, in consultation
    with the CEO and the Board Chair, also develops and maintains an
    evergreen list of continuing education topics which is
    periodically discussed with the Board members. This list
    includes topics of interest relating to the Corporation&#146;s
    businesses, operations and strategy, regulatory developments,
    compliance initiatives, as well as international geopolitical
    and economic reviews.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Mr.&#160;Girling and Ms.&#160;McLellan completed the
    Directors&#146; Education Program developed by the Institute of
    Corporate Directors (ICD)&#160;and the Joseph L. Rotman School
    of Management, University of Toronto. Ms.&#160;Gibara completed
    the Corporate Governance&#160;&#151; Making Boards More
    Effective Program provided by Harvard Business School.
</DIV>
<A name='125'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Board
    Performance Evaluation</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The CG&#038;N Committee conducts a periodic evaluation of our
    Board, the Board Chair, each of the Board Committees, and each
    of the Committee Chairs, in conjunction with an individual
    director assessment that is separately stewarded by our Board
    Chair with the assistance of an external corporate governance
    expert. The methodology includes in-depth interviews by the
    governance expert with each of the directors and members of
    senior management, the completion of an analytical Board
    effectiveness questionnaire by each of the directors, data
    analysis by the governance expert, feedback on preliminary
    findings, and reporting to and discussion among the directors.
    The Board evaluation process provides a forum within which to
    assess the Board&#146;s effectiveness and successes, as well as
    an opportunity to seek out opportunities for continuous
    improvement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    During the course of 2007 and 2008, a comprehensive evaluation
    of the Board, the Board Chair, each of the Board Committees, and
    the Committee Chairs was conducted with the assistance of an
    external corporate governance expert. The evaluation focused on
    identifying the areas in which the Board and its Committees
    function exceptionally well, as well as determining areas or
    activities where there may exist potential opportunities to
    further enhance Board effectiveness. These areas involved
    consideration of the Board&#146;s role with respect to strategic
    planning, enterprise risk management oversight, executive
    compensation processes, sustainability reporting, and Director
    and CEO succession planning. The Board reviewed and assessed
    emerging trends and best practices in each of these areas, and
    either concluded that the Board&#146;s processes are effective
    and consistent with current best practices, or implemented minor
    modifications to its procedures to enhance the Board
    effectiveness to ensure that the Board&#146;s processes and the
    execution of its oversight role meet or exceed current best
    practice standards.
</DIV>
<A name='126'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Director
    Succession Planning</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Board, through the CG&#038;N Committee, has the
    responsibility to review at least annually the skills and
    experience represented on the Board in light of the
    Corporation&#146;s strategic direction, opportunities and risks,
    having regard as well to the most recently conducted Board
    performance evaluation. As part of our Board Succession Planning
    and Director Recruitment Program, the CG&#038;N Committee
    maintains and regularly evaluates, at least annually, a
    comprehensive matrix regarding our current Board composition
    describing our current directors&#146; experience,
    qualifications, competencies and skills in order to allow the
    Board to focus on identifying and attracting new members that
    would most benefit our Board at any particular point in time.
    This process facilitates an ongoing review of the
    directors&#146; respective areas and levels of expertise in
    numerous areas, which include, among others, international
    business, mergers and acquisitions, financial and accounting,
    former CEO/senior officer experience, and experience in the
    areas of executive compensation, agricultural/chemical,
    operational/engineering, manufacturing/industrial, natural
    resources, marketing/sales, research&#160;&#038; development, as
    well as geographic, age and gender diversity. The CG&#038;N
    Committee also maintains a list of potential Board candidates
    for future consideration.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    15
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Our director recruiting process will generally involve a variety
    of methods as appropriate in the judgment of the Board,
    obtaining input from various sources and background checks.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In 2008, the CG&#038;N Committee also conducted a comprehensive
    review of our Board Chair Succession Planning Process in
    consultation with external governance. The review focused on the
    aspects of the Board Chair&#146;s role that will be important
    over the next few years, and included an assessment of the
    current Terms of Reference for the Board Chair and a
    determination of the ideal skills, experience, attributes and
    behavioural qualities for a successor Board Chair, as well as
    the consultative process to be undertaken with the members of
    the Board and the CEO to most effectively facilitate a Board
    Chair succession planning initiative. The consensus of the
    directors that arose during the course of this review was that
    there is no need to address Board Chair succession at this time
    given that (i)&#160;the Board Chair continues to do an excellent
    job in that role, and (ii)&#160;stable and experienced
    leadership is particularly important at this time given these
    uncertain economic times and ongoing market turmoil.
</DIV>
<A name='127'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Mandatory
    Director Retirement</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    We have a policy that a director shall not normally be nominated
    for election at the annual meeting of Shareholders next held
    following the date on which he or she attains the age of
    70&#160;years.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    16
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<A name='128'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">COMMITTEES
    OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS</FONT></U></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Board has four Standing Committees: the Audit Committee, the
    Human Resources&#160;&#038; Compensation Committee, the
    CG&#038;N Committee and the Environment, Health,
    Safety&#160;&#038; Security Committee.
</DIV>
<A name='129'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Audit
    Committee</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"><!-- TABLE 01 -->
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="14%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterleft -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="84%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B>Members</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    V. J. Zaleschuk, CA
    (Chair)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;R. K.
    Girling&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;F. W. Proto<BR>
    R. S.
    Cunningham&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;R.
    J. Horner
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<B>Charter</B> <BR><BR><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The full Audit <BR>Committee Charter<BR>is available at<BR>www.agrium.com<BR>under &#147;Corporate <BR>Governance&#148;</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
The mandate, procedure and composition requirements of the Audit Committee are set out in its Charter.<BR><BR>The mandate of the Audit Committee is to assist the Board&#146;s oversight of (i) our accounting and financial reporting processes, (ii) the quality and integrity of our financial statements and related disclosures, and (iii) the effectiveness of our internal controls.  The financial statements are prepared by and the responsibility of management.  The interim consolidated financial statements are reviewed by the Corporation&#146;s external auditors and then approved by the Audit Committee.  The external auditors express an independent opinion on the annual consolidated financial statements which are then approved by the Board upon the recommendation of the Audit Committee.</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
The Audit Committee&#146;s Charter explicitly mandates direct communication with our internal and external auditors independently of management, ongoing review of our external auditors, including recommendations to the Board of the appointment (subject to Shareholder approval) and termination of the external auditors, discussion and review of the scope of the audit and audit plans of the internal and external auditors, pre-approval of audit and permitted non-audit services, review of the qualifications, independence and fees of the external auditors, and establishment of hiring policies for employees or former employees of the external auditors.<BR><BR>Other responsibilities of the Audit Committee include:</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: 0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;monitoring compliance by the Corporation with legal and regulatory requirements that could have a material effect upon the financial position of the Corporation and that are not subject to the oversight of another committee of the Board;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: 0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;monitoring the Corporation&#146;s internal audit function;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: 0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;overseeing management reporting, internal controls and management information, and reviewing financial risk assessment and risk management issues;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: 0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing, prior to Board approval, the Corporation&#146;s annual audited consolidated financial statements and selected corporate disclosure documents, including management&#146;s discussion and analysis contained in our Annual Report, the Annual Information Form, prospectuses and offering documents, and other major shareholder communications containing significant financial information;</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: 0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;establishing procedures for: (a) the receipt, retention and treatment of complaints regarding accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing matters, and (b) the confidential, anonymous submissions by our employees of concerns regarding accounting or auditing matters; and
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: 0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing the Audit Committee Charter on an annual basis.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>2008<BR>
    Accomplishments<BR>
    and Key<BR>
    Activities</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
The accomplishments and key activities of the Audit Committee in 2008 included the following:<BR><BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
&#149; <B>Financial Reporting<BR><BR></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -24pt; margin-left: 24pt;">
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed and approved the Corporation&#146;s interim financial statements and management&#146;s discussion &#038; analysis, and reviewed and recommended to the Board for approval the Corporation&#146;s audited annual consolidated financial statements, and management&#146;s discussion &#038; analysis thereon;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>

<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -23pt; margin-left: 23pt">
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;monitored
    emerging trends and best practices with respect to financial
    reporting and corporate governance impacting on the mandate of
    the Audit Committee.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>Membership<BR>
    Criteria</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<B>Independence.</B> The Board has determined that each member of the Audit Committee is independent within the meaning of Multilateral Instrument 52-110 <I>Audit Committees </I>(&#147;<B>MI 52-110</B>&#148;) and none receives, directly or indirectly, any compensation from the Corporation other than for service as a director and a member of the Board committees of the Corporation.<BR><BR><B>Other Audit Committees.</B> Unless the Board determines otherwise, no member of the Audit Committee may serve on the audit committees of more than two other public companies.</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Financial<BR>
    Literacy of<BR>
    Members</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<B>Audit Committee Financial Expert.</B> The Board has determined that Mr. Zaleschuk is an &#147;audit committee financial expert&#148; for the purpose of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002.<BR><BR><B>Financial Literacy.</B> The Board has determined that each member of the Audit Committee is &#147;financially literate&#148; within the meaning of MI 52-110.  In considering whether a member of the Audit Committee is financially literate, the Board looks at the ability to read a set of financial statements, including a balance sheet, income statement and cash flow statement of a breadth and complexity similar to that of the Corporation&#146;s financial statements.  See the directors&#146; biographies on pages 4 through 8 for relevant education and experience of each member of the Audit Committee.</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B>Advisors</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The Audit Committee is empowered to engage outside advisors
    and/or consultants at the Corporation&#146;s expense, to assist
    the Audit Committee and/or provide advice on any matter within
    its mandate. The Audit Committee Chair leads the selection of
    these outside consultants and advisors, and the Audit Committee
    has the sole authority to retain and terminate such consultants
    or advisors, including the authority to approve their fees and
    other retention terms.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">

</TD>

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B>Auditors</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<B>Auditors Engagement.</B> KPMG LLP have been the Corporation&#146;s Auditors since 1993.  The Audit Committee is directly responsible for the engagement, retention and oversight of the external auditors, who report directly to the Audit Committee.<BR><BR><B>Independence.</B> The Audit Committee has determined that KPMG LLP is independent.  See &#147;Section Two: Matters to be Acted Upon at the Meeting&#160;&#151; Appointment of Auditors&#148; for details regarding fees paid to KPMG LLP for professional services in the years ended December 31, 2007 and 2008.<BR><BR><B>Audit Committee Oversight.</B> Since January 1, 2008, the commencement of our most recently completed financial year, there has been no recommendation of the Audit Committee to nominate or compensate an external auditor that has not been adopted by the Board.<BR><BR><B>Pre-Approval Policy and Procedure.</B> The Audit Committee has delegated to the Chair of the Audit Committee the authority to act on behalf of the Audit Committee between meetin
gs of the Audit Committee with respect to the pre-approval of audit and permitted non-audit services provided by KPMG LLP from time to time.  The Chair reports on any such pre-approval at each meeting of the Audit Committee.</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The Audit Committee met on seven occasions in 2008 and, as is
    required by the Audit Committee Charter, held <I>in camera
    </I>sessions without management present on all occasions
    (following every regularly scheduled meeting).  In addition to
    holding <I>in camera </I>sessions following every regularly
    scheduled meeting, Audit Committee procedure allows any director
    to move the committee to an <I>in camera </I>session at any time
    during a meeting.
</TD>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Corporate
    Governance&#160;&#038; Nominating Committee</FONT></B>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B>Members</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    G. Gibara (Chair)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;R.K.
    Girling&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;D. G.
    Pannell<BR>
    D.G.
    Devine&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;A.A.
    McLellan

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">

</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    On May 7, 2008, in connection with Neil Carragher&#146;s
    retirement from the Board and as Chair of the CG&#038;N
    Committee, Ms. Germaine Gibara was appointed Chair of the
    CG&#038;N Committee and Derek G. Pannell was appointed to the
    CG&#038;N Committee.  There were no other changes to the
    membership of the CG&#038;N Committee in 2008.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<B>Charter<BR><BR></B><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The full CG&#038;N<BR>Committee Charter<BR>is available at<BR>www.agrium.com<BR>under &#147;Corporate<BR>Governance&#148;</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
The mandate, procedure and composition requirements of the CG&#038;N Committee are set out in its Charter.<BR><BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
The mandate of the CG&#038;N Committee is to assist the Board in fulfilling its responsibilities relating to continuing review and development of Agrium&#146;s corporate governance system.  Responsibilities of the CG&#038;N Committee include:<BR><BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -9pt; margin-left: 9pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing and developing the Guidelines, Code of Business Conduct and Ethics for directors, officers and employees, the Charters for our Board and its committees, as well as Terms of Reference for our Board Chair, Committee Chairs, individual directors and the CEO;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: 0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing and recommending to the Board any reports on compliance with the governance guidelines and requirements of applicable regulators and securities exchanges;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: 0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing and recommending director compensation for Board and Committee service, and overseeing the administration of the DSU Plans (defined below);
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: 0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;annually evaluating the overall performance of the Board, the Board Chair, the Board Committees, the Committee Chairs, and individual directors;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;

</TD>

<DIV style="text-indent: 0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;monitoring the relationship between management and the Board to ensure that the Board is able to, and in fact does, function independently of management;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">

</TD>

<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;assisting the Board in identifying and recommending qualified individuals to become Board members, consistent with criteria approved by the Board, and to recommend to the Board persons for nomination to the Board;
</DIV>
</TD>

<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">

</DIV>
</TD>

</TD>

</DIV>
</TD>

</DIV>

</TD>
</TR>

<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">

</TD>

<TD align="left" valign="top">
    See &#147;Section Three: Corporate Governance&#148; for a
    description of the Guidelines, Board Charter and Terms of
    Reference for the Corporation&#146;s Board Chair, Committee
    Chairs, individual directors and CEO.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">

</TD>

<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
The accomplishments and key activities of the CG&#038;N Committee in 2008 included the following:<BR><BR>

    Derek Pannell) to fill the vacancy of a retiring director;

    <TD width="17%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->

<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -4pt; margin-left: 4pt">
    <B>&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;Evaluation of the Board, Committees,
    Board/Committee Chairs, and Individual Directors<BR>
    <BR>
    </B>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;assessed
    director independence against categorical standards and reviewed
    director relationships, commitments and interlocks;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;implemented
    a new comprehensive evaluation process for the Board, Board
    Committees, and Board and Committee Chairs, and stewarded the
    process engaging an external governance expert; and<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;assessed
    and updated, as appropriate, the Board and Committee Charters,
    Corporate Governance Guidelines, and the Board Manual.<BR>
    <BR>
    <B>&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;Corporate Governance Best
    Practices</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -24pt; margin-left: 24pt">
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;conducted
    a review of recent developments, emerging trends, and best
    practices with respect to the oversight of the Board and
    Committees in connection with enterprise risk management;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;recommended
    to the Board the implementation of a prohibition against <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;the
    monetization of equity-based compensation by executives and
    directors;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed,
    assessed, and enhanced the directors&#146; continuing education
    process;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;monitored
    recent developments, emerging trends, and best practices in <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;corporate
    governance; and<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed
    and recommended to the Board amendments to the Stock Option <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#038;
    Tandem SAR Plan, and the Director Deferred Share Unit Plans.<BR>
    <BR>
    <B>&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;Public Disclosures<BR>
    <BR>
    </B>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed
    and approved for recommendation to the Board the corporate <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;governance
    disclosures contained in the Circular.<BR>
    <BR>
    <B>&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;Board Remuneration<BR>
    <BR>
    </B>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;recommended
    the form and amount of the directors and Board <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Chair&#146;s
    compensation.
</DIV>
</TD>

    and the NYSE Listing Standards.

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B>Advisors</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The CG&#038;N Committee is empowered to engage outside advisors
    and/or consultants at the Corporation&#146;s expense, to assist
    the CG&#038;N Committee and/or provide advice on any matter
    within its mandate.  The CG&#038;N Committee Chair leads the
    selection of these outside consultants and advisors, and the
    CG&#038;N Committee has the sole authority to retain and
    terminate such consultants or advisors, including the authority
    to approve their fees and other retention terms.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">

    <B>Meetings</B>

<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The CG&#038;N Committee met on four occasions in 2008 and held
    <I>in camera </I>sessions without management present on four
    occasions (following every regularly scheduled meeting). In
    addition to holding <I>in camera </I>sessions following every
    regularly scheduled meeting, CG&#038;N Committee procedure
    allows any director to move the committee to an <I>in camera
    </I>session at any time during a meeting.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<A name='131'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 6%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Human
    Resources&#160;&#038; Compensation Committee</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="24%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterleft -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="74%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B>Members</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    R. J. Horner (Chair)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;G.
    Gibara&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;D. G. Pannell <BR>
    R. S. Cunningham&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;S. A.
    Henry&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;V. J. Zaleschuk, CA
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Derek G. Pannell was appointed to the Human Resources &#038;
    Compensation Committee (the &#147;<B>HR&#038;C
    Committee</B>&#148;) on May 7, 2008.  There were no other
    changes to the membership of the HR&#038;C Committee in 2008.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B>Charter</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The mandate, procedure and composition requirements of the
    HR&#038;C Committee are set out in its Charter.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The full HR&#038;C<BR>
    Committee Charter<BR>
    is available at<BR>
    www.agrium.com<BR>
    under &#147;Corporate<BR>
    Governance&#148;
    </FONT>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The mandate of the HR&#038;C Committee is to assist the Board in
    fulfilling its responsibilities relating to human resources
    matters.  Responsibilities of the HR&#038;C Committee
    include:<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;advising on human resources and
    compensation philosophies, strategies <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;and principles, including the
    review of compensation policies and programs <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;for employees;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing and approving the
    CEO&#146;s goals and objectives, assessing the <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;CEO&#146;s performance, and
    recommending the CEO&#146;s compensation;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;overseeing the evaluation of
    management, including recommendations to the <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Board regarding the appointment of
    and the compensation arrangements for <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;executives;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;assessing executive succession plans and
    practices;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing and making
    recommendations with respect to incentive <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;compensation and equity
    compensation plans and programs;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing and approving the
    investment, funding and benefits policies relating<BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;to retirement plans;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;overseeing the preparation of the
    Compensation Discussion &#038; <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Analysis
    (&#147;<B>CD&#038;A</B>&#148;) and related compensation
    disclosure; and<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing the HR&#038;C Committee
    Charter on an annual basis.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>2008<BR>
    Accomplishments and<BR>
    Key Activities</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The accomplishments and key activities of the HR&#038;C
    Committee in 2008 included the following:<BR>
    <BR>
    <B>&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;Compensation<BR>
    <BR>
    </B>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed
    compensation policies and programs in light of (i) the <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Corporation&#146;s
    growth and acquisitions, (ii) the changing dynamics in the North
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;American
    labour markets, and (iii) changing compensation disclosure
    regulation<BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;and
    voluntary best-practices guidelines for executive compensation;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -24pt; margin-left: 24pt">
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed
    and recommended to the Board for approval amendments to the
    Corporation&#146;s deferred compensation plans and arrangements
    so as to ensure documentary compliance of those plans and
    arrangements with Section 409A of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code
    of 1986 by December 31, 2008 in accordance with final U.S.
    Treasury Regulations;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">

    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed
    annual and long term award plans to ensure that such plans
    continued to meet the Corporation&#146;s compensation principles
    and objectives;

</TD>

    an option and SAR granting policy for implementation in 2009;

    the CEO&#146;s performance and made compensation recommendations
    to the Board;
</DIV>

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Membership<BR>
    Criteria</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Independence.</B> Each member of the HR&#038;C Committee is
    required to be independent within the meaning of the CSA Rules
    and the NYSE Listing Standards.  In addition, the CEO does not
    participate in the appointment of members to the HR&#038;C
    Committee.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Interlocks.</B> None of Agrium&#146;s executive officers has
    served as a member of a compensation committee (or equivalent
    committee) of any other entity that employs a member of the
    HR&#038;C Committee.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Sitting CEOs.</B> Mr. Cunningham is the only currently active
    chief executive officer of a publicly traded entity and,
    accordingly, less than one-third (namely 1 of 6) of the
    HR&#038;C Committee&#146;s members are currently active chief
    executive officers of publicly traded companies.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Human Resource<BR>
    and Financial<BR>
    Literacy of<BR>
    Members</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    HR&#038;C Committee members are appointed with a view to
    ensuring that the committee maintains an appropriate level of
    financial and human resources literacy.  All members of the
    HR&#038;C Committee are knowledgeable about Agrium&#146;s
    compensation programs.  Mr. Zaleschuk is considered by the Board
    to have financial expertise and has been designated as an
    &#147;audit committee financial expert&#148; for the purpose of
    the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002.  All of the members of the
    Committee are &#147;financially literate&#148; within the
    meaning of MI 52-110, and have been determined by the Committee
    to possess human resources literacy, meaning a thorough
    understanding of compensation theory and practice, people
    development and management, succession planning and executive
    development. Such knowledge and capability includes (i) current
    or prior experience working as chief executive or senior
    officers of major organizations (which provide significant
    financial and human resources experience), (ii) involvement on
    board compensation committees of other entities, and (iii)
    experience and education pertaining to financial accounting and
    reporting and familiarity with internal financial controls.  See
    the directors&#146; biographies on pages 4 through 8 for
    additional information.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>  <!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="74%">&nbsp;</TD>         <!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->

<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>Advisors</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    The HR&#038;C Committee is empowered to engage outside advisors
    and/or consultants at the Corporation&#146;s expense, to assist
    the HR&#038;C Committee and/or provide advice on any matter
    within its mandate.  The HR&#038;C Committee Chair leads the
    selection of these outside consultants and advisors, and the
    HR&#038;C Committee has the sole authority to retain and
    terminate such consultants or advisors, including the authority
    to approve their fees and other retention terms.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Compensation Consultant</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Consultant Retained.</B> The HR&#038;C Committee retained
    Towers Perrin in the most recent fiscal year to assist with
    preparing information and providing advice on senior executive
    and director compensation arrangements.  Materials provided by
    Towers Perrin have been presented by Towers Perrin and/or
    management to the HR&#038;C Committee for its independent review
    and approval. Towers Perrin&#146;s scope of services includes
    competitive reviews of senior executive and Board compensation
    levels, assisting management with changes to the design of
    compensation programs, providing trend information and other
    miscellaneous executive compensation assistance.  See
    &#147;Section Four: Executive Compensation&#160;&#151; 2008
    Compensation Discussion &#038; Analysis&#160;&#151; Compensation
    Process&#148; for details with respect to the duties performed
    by Towers Perrin in 2008.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Independence.</B> The HR&#038;C Committee has determined that
    Towers Perrin is independent from Agrium management and is
    satisfied that it receives impartial and independent advice from
    Towers Perrin on all matters relating to executive compensation.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Pre-Approval of Services</B>.  The HR&#038;C Committee is
    required to pre-approve any services requested by management
    from any compensation consultants engaged by HR&#038;C
    Committee.  The HR&#038;C Committee will not approve any work
    that, in its view, could compromise the independence of the
    compensation consultants engaged to advise the HR&#038;C
    Committee.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Quarterly Meetings with the HR&#038;C Committee Chair.</B>
    The Chair of the HR&#038;C Committee meets privately with the
    HR&#038;C Committee&#146;s compensation consultant each quarter
    to review ongoing compensation work and any proposed additional
    services, including any matters related to NEO compensation.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Fees Paid.</B> The fees paid to the Towers Perrin with
    respect to all work performed for the Corporation are as
    follows:
</TD>

<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Evaluation of Consultant.</B>&#160;&#160;The HR&#038;C
    Committee conducts an annual evaluation of the performance and
    independence of its external compensation consultant.  In
    connection with the completion of the 2008 compensation year,
    the HR&#038;C Committee evaluated the services of Towers Perrin
    and determined that it was satisfied with the effectiveness of
    the performance of Towers Perrin.
</TD>

<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The HR&#038;C Committee met on four occasions in 2008 and held
    <I>in camera</I> sessions without management present on four
    occasions (following every regularly scheduled meeting).  In
    addition to holding <I>in camera</I> sessions following every
    regularly scheduled meeting, HR&#038;C Committee procedure
    allows any director to move the committee to an <I>in camera</I>
    session at any time during a meeting.
</TD>
</TR>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<A name='132'>
<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Environment,
    Health, Safety&#160;&#038; Security Committee</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"><!-- TABLE 01 -->
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="24%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterleft -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="74%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B>Members</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    S.A. Henry (Chair)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;R.J.
    Horner&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;F.W.
    Proto<BR>
    D.G.
    Devine&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;A.A.
    McLellan
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B>Charter</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The mandate, procedure and composition requirements of the
    Environment, Health, Safety &#038; Security Committee (the
    &#147;<B>EHS&#038;S Committee</B>&#148;) are set out in its
    Charter.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 5pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The full EHS&#038;S<BR>
    Committee Charter<BR>
    is available at<BR>
    www.agrium.com<BR>
    under &#147;Corporate Governance&#148;
    </FONT>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The mandate of the EHS&#038;S Committee is to assist the Board
    in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities in order to ensure
    the Corporation&#146;s activities are conducted in an
    environmentally responsible manner and that the Corporation
    maintains the integrity of its health, safety and security
    policies.  Responsibilities of the EHS&#038;S Committee
    include:<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;annually reviewing and recommending to
    the Board for approval the <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Environment, Health, Safety &#038;
    Security Policy;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;monitoring environmental, health and
    safety performance, compliance with <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;legal and regulatory requirements,
    as well as applicable industry standards relating <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;to environmental, health and
    safety matters, and reviewing the strategies and <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;methods used to improve our
    environmental, health, safety and security <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;performance;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing our environmental, health,
    safety and security performance <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;goals, management systems
    implementation, audit programs and plans, and the <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;status of our remediation projects
    and provisions;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing the methods of communicating
    our environmental, health, safety <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;and security policies and
    procedures throughout the organization; and<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing the EHS&#038;S Committee
    Charter on an annual basis.<BR>
    <BR>
    In addition, it is the practice of the EHS&#038;S Committee to
    arrange at least one visit annually for our Board members to one
    of our facilities, which includes orientation sessions to
    personally acquaint members of the Committee and the Board with
    personnel and operations at our facilities.<BR>
    <BR>
    The Corporation has a corporate environment, health &#038;
    safety and security committee composed of members of senior
    management and chaired by the Senior Vice President, Retail,
    which is responsible for ensuring that we conduct our activities
    and operate our facilities in an environmentally responsible
    manner and maintain the integrity of our health, safety and
    security policies.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>2008<BR>
    Accomplishments and<BR>
    Key Activities</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The accomplishments and key activities of the EHS&#038;S
    Committee in 2008 included the following:<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;oversaw the Corporation&#146;s best
    EHS&#038;S performance in 2008 over prior <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;years against identified key
    performance indicators;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed the EHS&#038;S integration
    activities related to the Corporation&#146;s <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;recent acquisitions, and in
    particular the implementation of enhanced focus on <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;safety in Royster-Clark and UAP,
    resulting in improved EHS&#038;S performance in <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;those entities;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed a strengthened Environmental
    Management System and <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;its implementation within the
    strategic business units;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed and provided input to the
    Corporation&#146;s Sustainability Report;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;conducted a site visit to review the
    issues relating to, and the status of, legacy <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;mine site remediation activities
    in Manitoba;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    25
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"><!-- TABLE 01 -->

<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="24%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterleft -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="74%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -4pt; margin-left: 4pt">
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed the formation of 4 newly
    created governance teams to enhance <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;practices and improve communications in
    the areas of risk management, <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;product stewardship, security and crisis
    management, and environmental liability;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -4pt; margin-left: 4pt">
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed, in conjunction with the
    Audit Committee, the <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Corporation&#146;s classification,
    accounting and reporting processes, and key controls, <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;relating to Asset Retirement Obligations
    and Environmental Remediation <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Liabilities;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;evaluated the Corporation&#146;s
    EHS&#038;S practices and programs to <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;identify performance in light of current
    best practices; and<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed and recommended to the Board
    revisions to the EHS&#038;S Policy <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;and EHS&#038;S Charter to include
    expanded focus on safety.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Membership<BR>
    Criteria</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Each member of the EHS&#038;S Committee is required by the
    Charter to be independent within the meaning of the CSA Rules
    and the NYSE Listing Standards.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B>Advisors</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The EHS&#038;S Committee is empowered to engage outside advisors
    and/or consultants at the Corporation&#146;s expense, to assist
    the EHS&#038;S Committee and/or provide advice on any matter
    within its mandate.  The EHS&#038;S Committee Chair leads the
    selection of these outside consultants and advisors, and the
    EHS&#038;S Committee has the sole authority to retain and
    terminate such consultants or advisors, including the authority
    to approve their fees and other retention terms.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B>Meetings</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
The EHS&#038;S Committee met on four occasions in 2008 and held <I>in camera </I>sessions without management present on four occasions (following every regularly scheduled meeting).  In addition to holding <I>in camera </I>sessions following every regularly scheduled meeting, EHS&#038;S Committee procedure allows any director to move the committee to an <I>in camera </I>session at any time during a meeting.<BR><BR>EHS&#038;S Committee meets separately with the Director, Environment, Health, Safety &#038; Security, and reports to the Board on such meetings.</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Availability of<BR>
    Committee</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Members of the EHS&#038;S Committee will be available at the
    Meeting to answer Shareholders&#146; inquiries in the areas
    covered by the EHS&#038;S Committee&#146;s mandate.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<A name='133'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">2008
    DIRECTOR COMPENSATION: TABLES AND NARRATIVE</FONT></U></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<A name='134'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Director
    Compensation Program</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The director compensation program was designed to reflect the
    responsibilities, commitments and risks accompanying Board
    membership and to assist the Corporation in attracting and
    retaining individuals with necessary experience and abilities.
    Non-executive director compensation is comprised of cash
    retainers and fees (payable in cash or in deferred share units
    (&#147;<B>DSU</B>s&#148;)) and DSU retainers. Please see below
    for a description of the deferred share unit fee plan (the
    &#147;<B>DSU Fee Plan</B>&#148;) (which allows directors to
    elect to receive cash retainers and fees in DSUs instead of
    cash) and the deferred share unit grant plan (the &#147;<B>DSU
    Grant Plan</B>&#148;) (pursuant to which DSU retainers are
    paid). The compensation arrangements for non-executive directors
    in 2008 were as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
