<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Notes:</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The Board Chair does not receive
    meeting fees, but attends all Board and Committee meetings.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">A travel allowance of U.S. $1,000
    is paid to each non-executive director who travels out of his or
    her province or state of residence to a meeting site.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The CG&#038;N Committee annually reviews director compensation
    using comparative Canadian and U.S.&#160;data provided by an
    independent compensation consultant (see the section entitled
    &#147;Human Resources&#160;&#038; Compensation Committee&#148;
    (above) for information regarding the consultant retained).
    There were no changes made to director compensation in 2008.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Our Chief Executive Officer, being the only executive director
    of the Corporation, is not entitled to additional compensation
    for performance of director duties. The director compensation
    program is distinct from the executive compensation program and
    non-executive directors are not eligible to receive pensions,
    non-equity incentives, stock options, benefits or perks from the
    Corporation. Please see &#147;Section&#160;Four: Executive
    Compensation&#148; (below) for a description of the executive
    compensation program.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    27
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">2008
    Summary of Director Compensation</FONT></B>
</DIV>

    The following compensation table (the &#147;<B>Director
    Compensation Table</B>&#148;) sets out the compensation paid to
    each of the Corporation&#146;s directors in the year ended
    December&#160;31, 2008:

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=455 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Notes:</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Includes the portion of the
    directors&#146; cash retainers, attendance fees and travel
    allowances paid in cash.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Includes the grant date fair value
    of directors&#146; DSU retainers and the portion of the
    directors&#146; cash retainers, attendance fees and travel
    allowance taken in DSUs. DSUs are granted based on the intended
    cash value, whereby the number of DSUs granted is determined by
    dividing the intended cash value of the grant by the average
    market price (converted to USD at the Bank of Canada noon rate
    on the date of grant) of the Common Shares on the TSX for the 10
    trading days preceding the date of grant (the &#147;<B>Average
    Market Price</B>&#148;). As a result, the grant date fair value
    for each grant was calculated on the basis of the Average Market
    Price, being $64.55 (Q1), $107.85 (Q2), $73.39 (Q3) and $31.46
    (Q4), multiplied by the total number of DSUs granted. The
    amounts reported exclude DSUs issued as an adjustment for
    dividends.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(3)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Includes the dollar value of any
    dividends or other earnings paid or payable on share-based
    awards that were not factored into grant date fair value.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(4)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Mr.&#160;Carragher retired from the
    Board on May&#160;7, 2008 and the compensation reported is
    compensation paid to Mr.&#160;Carragher for services provided
    prior to the date of his retirement.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(5)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Mr.&#160;Pannell was appointed to
    the Board on February&#160;27, 2008.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(6)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">As an executive of Agrium,
    Mr.&#160;Wilson is not paid any director compensation. Please
    see &#147;Section&#160;Four: Executive Compensation&#148; for
    information regarding compensation paid to Mr.&#160;Wilson in
    his role as CEO of Agrium.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=455 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>Notes:</B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The amount reported is the grant
    date fair value of the total DSUs granted (including cash fees
    taken as DSUs and DSU retainers). See note (2)&#160;to the
    Director Compensation Table for a description of the calculation
    of grant date fair value.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Excludes DSUs issued as an
    adjustment for dividends.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(3)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Mr.&#160;Carragher retired from the
    Board on May&#160;7, 2008 and the compensation reported is
    compensation paid to Mr.&#160;Carragher for services provided
    prior to the date of his retirement.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

    <TD align="right" valign="top">

    </FONT></TD>

    </FONT></TD>

    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(6)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The Board Chair does not receive
    meeting fees, but attends all meetings.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<A name='136'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Incentive
    Plan Awards to Directors</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Stock
    Options</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In March 2002, the Board amended the Stock Option Plan (defined
    below) so that non-executive directors would no longer be
    eligible to receive stock options. There are no other stock
    option plans of the Corporation in which the directors are
    eligible to participate. As at March&#160;23, 2009,
    non-executive directors held 10,000 options to acquire Common
    Shares that were granted prior to the March 2002 amendment of
    the Stock Option Plan. These options have exercise prices of
    Cdn.$14.15 and Cdn.$16.01 per share, being the closing prices of
    the Common Shares at the time of the grant, and expire ten years
    after the date of grant.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Deferred
    Share Units</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In December 2001, the Board approved the DSU Fee Plan for all
    directors. The DSU Fee Plan allows directors to elect to receive
    the cash portion of their remuneration in the form of DSUs, cash
    or any combination thereof, subject to having satisfied the
    share ownership requirements set out in our Guidelines. The
    number of DSUs issued each quarter is calculated by dividing the
    electing director&#146;s quarterly remuneration by the market
    value of the Common Shares on the date the director&#146;s
    compensation is converted into DSUs (generally the last business
    day of each quarter). See note (2)&#160;of the Directors
    Compensation Table (above) for a description of the calculation
    of market value. A director leaving the Board is entitled to
    receive the then market value of a Common Share for each DSU
    held. During 2008, directors were issued a total of 9,085 DSUs
    under the DSU Fee Plan (including 55 DSUs issued as an
    adjustment for dividends paid on the Common Shares in 2008). See
    <B>Schedule &#147;E&#148; </B>for a comprehensive description of
    the DSU Fee Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In May 2002, the Board approved the DSU Grant Plan which allows
    the Board to grant DSUs to directors. Board members are granted
    DSUs as part of their annual retainer. The number of DSUs issued
    is calculated by
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    29
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    dividing the DSU grant value by the market value of the Common
    Shares on the grant date. A director leaving the Board is
    entitled to receive the then market value of a Common Share for
    each DSU held. During 2008, directors were issued a total of
    8,930 DSUs under the DSU Grant Plan (including 190 DSUs issued
    as an adjustment for dividends paid on the Common Shares in
    2008). See <B>Schedule &#147;E&#148; </B>for a comprehensive
    description of the DSU Grant Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Outstanding
    share-based awards and option-based awards</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table provides details regarding the value of
    unvested/unexercised option and share-based awards as at
    December&#160;31, 2008:
</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The outstanding option-based awards
    shown are fully vested.
    </FONT></TD>

<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">These options have exercise prices
    of Cdn.$14.15 and Cdn.$16.01 per share, which exercise prices
    have been converted to USD based on the Bank of Canada noon rate
    on the date of grant, being the conversion rate of U.S.$1.00 =
    Cdn.$1.5793 on September&#160;27, 2001 and U.S.$1.00 =
    Cdn.$1.5767 on December&#160;6, 2001.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(3)
    </FONT></TD>

    in-the-money options&#148; and &#147;Market or payout value of
    unexercised DSUs&#148; was determined by reference to the
    closing price of Common Shares on the NYSE on December&#160;31,
    2008, being U.S.$34.13 per Common Share.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

    holder ceases to be a member of the Board. The amounts reported
    represent DSUs which were vested but not exercisable in the
    fiscal year.
    </FONT></TD>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Incentive
    plan awards&#160;&#151; value vested or earned during the
    year</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 4pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table provides details regarding the outstanding
    share-based awards that vested and were exercisable during the
    year ended December&#160;31, 2008:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 10pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=05 type=lead -->

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=455 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>Notes:</B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Value of DSUs was determined by
    reference to the closing price of the Common Shares on the NYSE
    on December&#160;31, 2008, being U.S.$34.13 per Common Share.
    The amounts reported exclude DSUs issued as an adjustment for
    dividends.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">All DSUs vest on grant,
    accordingly, the amounts reported represent the value of all
    DSUs granted in 2008.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(3)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">DSUs are not exercisable until the
    holder ceases to be a member of the Board. The amount that is
    exercisable is the value of DSUs which became exercisable by
    board members in the fiscal year due to the retirement or
    resignation of a director. With the exception of DSUs held by
    Mr.&#160;Carragher (as discussed in Note (4) (below)), no DSUs
    were exercisable by directors in 2008.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(4)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Mr.&#160;Carragher retired from the
    Board on May&#160;7, 2008 and all DSUs held by him became
    exercisable upon his retirement.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<A name='137'>
<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Equity
    Ownership Requirements</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Our Guidelines provide that each director is expected to acquire
    and maintain Common Share and DSU ownership with a value of
    approximately five times his or her annual cash retainer within
    five years of their appointment to the Board and to receive
    compensation in DSUs until the minimum equity ownership
    threshold is met.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table sets out the equity ownership interest in
    the Corporation and any changes therein, since our 2008 proxy
    circular disclosure, for each of our independent directors who
    are nominees for election to the Board:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="19%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=lead -->
    <TD width="4%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=lead -->
    <TD width="3%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=hang1 -->

    our Board on February&#160;27, 2008, and as such is expected to
    acquire equity ownership (including Common Shares and DSUs) of
    approximately five times his annual retainer within five years
    of his appointment to the Board.
    </FONT></TD>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<A name='138'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">SECTION&#160;FOUR:
    EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Corporation reports its financial results in
    U.S.&#160;dollars. The following CD&#038;A and executive
    compensation disclosure is prepared showing U.S.&#160;dollars,
    except as otherwise noted. Canadian dollars is the currency in
    which the majority of the named executive officers
    (&#147;<B>NEOs</B>&#148;) are paid.
</DIV>
<A name='139'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">2008
    COMPENSATION DISCUSSION&#160;&#038; ANALYSIS</FONT></U></B>

</A>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>
<A name='140'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Executive
    Summary</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following provides an overview of Agrium&#146;s compensation
    philosophy and programs as detailed in the &#147;2008
    Compensation Discussion&#160;&#038; Analysis&#148;:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Agrium&#146;s compensation programs are designed to attract and
    retain excellent employees, motivate and reward excellent
    performance, and promote Agrium&#146;s corporate values.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Agrium believes in pay-for-performance which is why
    approximately 70% of NEO target compensation is
    &#147;at-risk&#148; and is linked to a combination of individual
    and corporate goals and share price performance.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The components of NEO compensation are: base salary, cash-based
    annual incentive awards, equity based long-term incentives
    (including stock options, stock appreciation rights, and
    performance share units), benefits, perks, and pensions.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Long-term incentives are used to align executive actions with
    long-term management and Shareholder goals, providing rewards
    consistent with the creation of Shareholder value. They also
    help Agrium to retain executives and provide executives with the
    opportunity to meet equity ownership guidelines.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    32
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    All elements of the executive compensation program are targeted
    to provide compensation opportunities to executives at the
    median of their designated peer group. Actual payouts under
    these programs can be above or below the median based on
    individual and company performance. Compensation for outstanding
    performance is targeted at the 75th&#160;percentile of the
    executive&#146;s designated peer group.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Annual performance incentives are linked directly to short-term
    goals and performance, in line with Agrium&#146;s
    &#147;pay-for-performance&#148; philosophy.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    In 2008, amid market turmoil, Agrium had an extraordinary year,
    surpassing its previous records for net sales, profits and
    earnings and delivering on its key corporate priorities.
    Agrium&#146;s employees and senior officers (including the NEOs)
    have been rewarded for Agrium&#146;s exceptional 2008
    performance through the payment of maximum or near maximum
    annual incentives.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Executives participate in group benefit programs on
    substantially the same terms as other salaried employees.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Executives are provided with limited perks, such as automobile
    allowances, parking and financial planning, which are granted to
    ensure the compensation mix is competitive with our peers and to
    focus executives on job performance.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Agrium promotes and protects Shareholder interests by, among
    other things, requiring minimum equity ownership by executives,
    prohibiting hedging by executives, and safeguarding against
    insider trading.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The NEOs who are the focus of the CD&#038;A and who appear in
    the compensation tables of the Circular are:
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="8%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B>Michael M. Wilson</B>, President&#160;&#038; Chief Executive
    Officer
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B>Bruce G. Waterman</B>, Senior Vice President, Finance, &#038;
    Chief Financial Officer
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B>Richard L. Gearheard</B>, Senior Vice President, Agrium, and
    President, Retail
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B>Ron A. Wilkinson</B>, Senior Vice President, Agrium, and
    President, Wholesale
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B>Leslie O&#146;Donoghue</B>, Senior Vice President, General
    Counsel&#160;&#038; Corporate Secretary
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<A name='141'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Human
    Resources&#160;&#038; Compensation Committee</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The HR&#038;C Committee is responsible for ensuring that
    Agrium&#146;s executive compensation policies and programs are
    competitive in the markets in which Agrium competes for human
    resources and that they reflect the long term interests of the
    Corporation and its Shareholders. Details with respect to the
    HR&#038;C Committee&#146;s Charter and mandate, its 2008
    accomplishments and key activities, its independence from
    management and other criteria for HR&#038;C Committee membership
    are set out in &#147;Section&#160;Three: Corporate
    Governance&#160;&#151; Committees of the Board of
    Directors&#160;&#151; Human Resources&#160;&#038; Compensation
    Committee&#148; (above). Details with respect to the HR&#038;C
    Committee&#146;s oversight of and role in the compensation
    process are set out under the heading &#147;Compensation
    Process&#148; (below).
</DIV>
<A name='142'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Agrium&#146;s
    Business</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    With annual sales of $10.3-billion in 2008 (as compared to
    $5.5-billion in 2007), Agrium is a retailer of agricultural
    products and services in the U.S.&#160;as well as Argentina and
    Chile, and a global producer and wholesale marketer of nutrients
    for agricultural and industrial markets. Agrium operates and
    reports its business through three strategic business units:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The <B>Retail Business Unit</B>, with net sales of $5.5-billion
    in 2008 (as compared to $2.5-billion in 2007)&#160;operates in
    North and South America, providing crop inputs (including a
    range of seeds, and liquid and dry nutrients) and crop
    protection services (including herbicides, insecticides and
    fungicides) directly to farmers. Agrium&#146;s 2008 acquisition
    of a 100% interest in UAP Holding Corp.
    (&#147;<B>UAP</B>&#148;), one of the largest distributors of
    agricultural and non-crop products in North America,
    significantly increased the Retail Business Unit&#146;s
    distribution centres.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    33
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The <B>Wholesale Business Unit</B>, with net sales of
    $4.7-billion in 2008 (as compared to $2.8-billion in 2007),
    operates in North and South America and produces, markets and
    distributes all major crop nutrients (including nitrogen, potash
    and phosphate) for agricultural and industrial customers both
    domestically and around the world. Agrium&#146;s 2008
    acquisition of a 70% interest in Common Market Fertilizers S.A.
    (&#147;<B>CMF</B>&#148;) expands the Wholesale Business
    Unit&#146;s distribution capacity globally. The Wholesale
    Business Unit services its customers through a network of over
    100 distribution warehouses, supplied by 13 major production
    facilities in addition to a number of smaller processing and
    specialty facilities.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The <B>Advanced Technologies Business Unit</B>, with net sales
    of $352-million in 2008 (as compared to $249-million in 2007),
    develops, produces and markets controlled release nutrients for
    sale to the agricultural, golf course, turf and ornamental
    markets of North America, China and other parts of the Pacific
    Rim.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In addition, a variety of corporate functions are included in a
    fourth non-operating Corporate Business Unit that provides
    support and services to the three strategic business units.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of December&#160;31, 2008, Agrium employed approximately
    10,975&#160;people worldwide. Over the past few years, Agrium
    has experienced, and continues to experience, exceptional
    growth. For more information about Agrium&#146;s business and
    operations please see our Annual Information Form dated
    February&#160;25, 2009 and filed under the Corporation&#146;s
    profile on SEDAR (at www.sedar.com) and EDGAR (at
    www.sec.gov/edgar.shtml).
</DIV>
<A name='143'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Principles/Objectives
    of Compensation Program</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The objectives of Agrium&#146;s compensation programs are to:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    attract and retain the most talented people by providing
    competitive total compensation;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    motivate and reward employees to achieve Agrium&#146;s measures
    of success by &#147;paying for performance&#148; and rewarding
    demonstrated behaviours that reinforce Agrium&#146;s values and
    help the Corporation deliver on its corporate objectives,
    including:
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="8%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    shareholder return, as measured by stock price appreciation plus
    dividends on a reinvested basis,
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    corporate and business unit financial performance, including
    (i)&#160;earnings per share, (ii)&#160;cash flow,
    (iii)&#160;disciplined investment, and (iv)&#160;certification
    of internal controls,
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    company strategy achievements, including (i)&#160;industry
    leadership growth, (ii)&#160;employee health and safety, and
    (iii)&#160;creation and sustenance of high performance culture,
    and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    individual performance focused on financial and operational
    measures;
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    promote adherence to high ethical, environmental and health and
    safety standards;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    provide flexibility so that the compensation program is
    responsive to changes in the marketplace, organization and
    economic conditions;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    protect Shareholder interests and ensure that the interests of
    leaders are aligned with those of Shareholders.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    34
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<A name='144'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Compensation
    Program Design</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The total compensation mix and performance-based compensation
    opportunities are designed on the basis of our compensation
    objectives and in order to motivate employees to achieve the
    Corporation&#146;s strategic plan and overall goals of superior
    total Shareholder return through revenue growth, EBITDA growth,
    superior returns on invested capital and a balanced portfolio of
    products, assets and geographies.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">2008
    Compensation Mix</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Standard compensation arrangements for Agrium&#146;s senior
    executives are composed of the following elements, which are
    linked to Agrium&#146;s compensation and corporate objectives as
    follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    Senior executives (including each NEO) are paid a pre-determined
    base salary.  Salary is a market-competitive, fixed level of
    annual compensation.

    <BR>

    to achieve corporate objectives. Yearly salary review based on
    attainment of NEO goals, specifically linked to corporate
    objectives.  See &#147;Determining Actual Compensation&#148;
    (below).
</TD>

<TD colspan="7" valign="top">

<DIV style="text-indent: -7pt; margin-left: 7pt">
    Benefits and Perks

&nbsp;
</TD>

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
Senior executives (including NEOs) are entitled to standard health benefits on substantially the same terms as are available to employees under a shared cost flexible benefits program.<BR><BR>The Corporation provides perks to certain senior executives (including the NEOs), which include automobile allowances, parking and financial planning.<BR><BR>In addition, officers are entitled to limited benefits on termination of employment, as described under &#147;2008 Executive Compensation: Tables and Narrative&#160;&#151; Termination and Change of Control Benefits&#148; (below).</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Attract and Retain
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Competitive benefits and perks ensure access to talented
    employees necessary to achieve corporate objectives.  In
    addition, appropriate perks facilitate focus on job performance.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="7" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>

    <B>Retirement Arrangements</B>
</DIV>

</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;

&nbsp;
</TD>

</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
Senior executives (including NEOs) participate in defined contribution plans (the registered DC Plan for Canadian executives and the qualified 401(k) Plan for U.S. executives), pursuant to which the Corporation and participants contribute a percentage of eligible base salary.<BR><BR>Designated executives (including the NEOs) are also members of the defined benefit supplemental executive retirement plans (the Canadian DB SERP for Canadian executives and the U.S. DB SERP for U.S. executives), pursuant to which designated executives receive a supplemental defined benefit pension based on eligible earnings and years of service as a designated executive.<BR><BR>See &#147;2008 Executive Compensation: Tables and Narrative&#160;&#151; Pension Plan Benefits&#148; for detailed descriptions of the DC Plan, the 401(k) Plan, the Canadian DB SERP and the U.S. DB SERP.</DIV>
</TD>

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Attract and Retain
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;

    Competitive retirement arrangements ensure access to talented
    employees necessary to achieve corporate objectives.
</TD>
</TR>

<TD colspan="7" valign="top">

</TD>

&nbsp;

    Annual incentives focus executive attention on key strategic,
    operational and financial measures and align pay with
    performance.
</TD>

<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="7" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>

&nbsp;
</TD>

    <B>Profit Sharing Plan</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Certain employees (including the NEOs) are eligible to
    participate in the profit sharing plan (the &#147;<B>Profit
    Sharing Plan</B>&#148;), which provides annual incentive
    compensation up to a predetermined percentage of each
    employee&#146;s base salary if EBITDA targets are met by the
    Corporation.
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Motivate and Reward
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
The Profit Sharing Plan focuses on the achievement of EBITDA targets.<BR><BR>See &#147;Determining Actual Compensation&#148; (below) for details regarding 2008 EBITDA targets.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="7" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>

</TD>

    <BR>
    35

<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>Compensation<BR>
    </B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>Link to Corporate<BR>
    </B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom" align="center">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
    <B>Compensation Element</B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>Description</B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>Objectives</B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>Objectives</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="line-height: 5pt; font-size: 1pt">
<TD>&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD colspan="3" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -7pt; margin-left: 7pt">
    <B>Performance Recognition Plan</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Agrium Corporate and Wholesale employees (including all NEOs)
    participate in the performance recognition plan (the
    &#147;<B>Performance Recognition Plan</B>&#148;), which provides
    annual incentive compensation up to a predetermined percentage
    of each employee&#146;s base salary if key performance measures
    and individual performance goals are met.  The Performance
    Recognition Plan is designed to recognize the cyclical nature of
    the industry and balances management&#146;s focus on the
    achievement of critical corporate and business unit financial
    metrics, operating metrics and the achievement of longer term
    objectives linked to the annual business plan and the longer
    term business strategy.
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Motivate and Reward
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
The Performance Recognition Plan focuses on the achievement of objectives at the corporate, business, unit and individual level, including achievement of Agrium&#146;s key performance indicators (&#147;<B>KPIs</B>&#148;).<BR><BR>See &#147;Determining Actual Compensation&#148; (below) for discussion of KPIs.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="7" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="7" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD colspan="3" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -7pt; margin-left: 7pt">
    <B>Retail Incentive Plan</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
Retail Business Unit employees (including senior executives of the Retail Business Units, but excluding the President of the Retail Business Unit) are eligible to participate in the Retail Incentive Plan (the &#147;<B>Retail Plan</B>&#148;), which provides access to an annual incentive of up to a predetermined percentage of the employee&#146;s salary based on the achievement of local, regional and Business Unit EBIT targets and Business Unit KPI targets.<BR><BR><B>None of the NEOs are eligible to participate in the Retail Plan.</B> Accordingly, further information with respect to the Retail Plan has not been included in the CD&#038;A.</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Motivate and Reward
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The Retail Plan focuses on EBIT targets and achievement of
    Business Unit KPIs.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="7" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="7" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD colspan="3" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -7pt; margin-left: 7pt">
    <B>Advanced Technologies Incentive Plan</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
Advanced Technologies Business Unit employees (including senior executives of the Advanced Technologies Business Unit, but excluding the President of the Advanced Technologies Business Unit) are eligible to participate in the Advanced Technologies Incentive Plan (the &#147;<B>AAT Plan</B>&#148;), which provides access to an annual incentive of up to a predetermined percentage of the employee&#146;s salary based on the achievement of local, regional and Business Unit targets and Business Unit KPI targets.<BR><BR><B>None of the NEOs are eligible to participate in the AAT Plan. </B>Accordingly, further information with respect to the AAT Plan has not been included in the CD&#038;A.</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Motivate and Reward
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The AAT Plan focuses on achieving business unit targets measured
    by return on investment capital and is funded based on a share
    of EBITDA.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="7" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="7" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD colspan="7" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -7pt; margin-left: 7pt">
    <B>Long-Term Incentives</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The Corporation believes that the PSU Plan (defined below) and
    the Stock Option Plan (defined below) (i) provide for a balanced
    long-term incentive approach that recognizes the cyclical nature
    of the business, (ii) provide a better total alignment with
    Shareholder interests and (iii) facilitate long-term equity
    ownership.
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="7" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="7" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD colspan="3" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -7pt; margin-left: 7pt">
    <B>Stock Options and Tandem SARs</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
Certain employees (including NEOs) are eligible to participate in the Stock Option and Tandem SAR Plan (the &#147;<B>Stock Option Plan</B>&#148;).  The Corporation may grant options to purchase Common Shares at the closing price on the day preceding the grant.  Vesting of options is determined by the Board at the time of grant; although, options generally vest in 25% increments over four years and expire ten years after the date of grant.<BR><BR>Commencing in 2004, Agrium made grants of stock options in tandem with stock appreciation rights (&#147;<B>SARs</B>&#148;) to eligible Canadian employees.  Option holders have the right to surrender vested stock options back to the Corporation in exchange for a cash payment from the Corporation equal to the option gain that would have otherwise been realized.  This assists in the management of Shareholder dilution related to the Stock Option Plan, provides increased transparency through variable accounting for the purposes of expensing stock options and ensures that 
the costs of funding the stock option grants are tax deductible by the Corporation.<BR><BR>See <B>Schedule &#147;E&#148; </B>for a detailed description of the Stock Option Plan.</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Attract and Retain<BR>
    <BR>
    Motivate<BR>
    <BR>
    Align executive and Shareholder interests
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
Competitive stock option grants ensure access to talented employees necessary to achieve corporate objectives.<BR><BR>Motivates employees to achieve corporate goals and improve value of Common Shares, as stock options gain value only if share price increases over grant price.<BR><BR>Encourages sustained, long-term growth by linking portion of compensation to long-term company performance.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="7" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>

    <B>Compensation Element</B>

    <B>Description</B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>Objectives</B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>Objectives</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="line-height: 5pt; font-size: 1pt">
<TD>&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD colspan="3" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -7pt; margin-left: 7pt">
    <B>Stock Appreciation Rights</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
Certain employees (including NEOs) who are not residents of Canada are eligible to participate in the Stock Appreciation Rights Plan (the &#147;<B>SAR Plan</B>&#148;), pursuant to which the Corporation may grant stand-alone SARs.  The Corporation may grant SARs at the closing price of the Common Shares on the day preceding the grant.  Vesting of SARs is determined by the Board at the time of grant; although, SARs generally vest in 25% increments over four years and expire ten years after the date of grant.<BR><BR>See <B>Schedule &#147;E&#148; </B>for a detailed description of the SAR Plan.</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Attract and Retain<BR>
    <BR>
    Motivate<BR>
    <BR>
    Align executive and Shareholder interests
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Competitive SAR grants ensure access to talented employees
    necessary to achieve corporate objectives.<BR>
    <BR>
    Motivates employees to achieve corporate goals and improve value
    of Common Shares, as SARs gain value only if share price
    increases over grant price.<BR>
    <BR>
    Encourages sustained, long-term growth by linking portion of
    compensation to long-term company performance.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="7" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="7" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD colspan="3" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -7pt; margin-left: 7pt">
    <B>Performance Share Units</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
Senior executives (including NEOs) and key employees are eligible to participate in either the Performance Share Unit Plan for Canadian employees (the &#147;<B>Canadian PSU Plan</B>&#148;) or the Performance Share Unit Plan for U.S. employees (the &#147;<B>U.S. PSU Plan</B>&#148; and, collectively with the Canadian PSU Plan, the &#147;<B>PSU Plan</B>&#148;), pursuant to which the Corporation may grant performance share units (&#147;<B>PSUs</B>&#148;).  The value of a PSU is tied to the value of the Common Shares, based on the price of Common Shares on the NYSE.  The grant of a PSU will entitle the employee to the right to receive a cash payment equal to the market value of the PSU at the completion of a three-year performance period.<BR><BR>PSUs (including dividend equivalent performance share units) vest at the end of a three-year performance cycle beginning on January 1 of the grant year and ending on December 31 three years thereafter.  The number of units that vest depends on the relative ranking of the 
Corporation&#146;s Total Shareholder Return over the three-year performance cycle compared to the Total Shareholder Return over the same period for a selected peer group of companies.  One hundred percent of the PSUs vest if the Corporation&#146;s Total Shareholder Return is equal to the median of the peer group.  Vesting ranges between 50% for performance at or below the 25th&#160;percentile and up to 150% for performance at or above the 75th&#160;percentile.  If the Corporation&#146;s Total Shareholder Return is negative over a three-year performance cycle, the percentage of PSUs that vest may not exceed 100%.  No PSUs vest if, over the three-year performance cycle, the Corporation&#146;s Total Shareholder Return is both negative and falls below the 25th&#160;percentile of the selected peer group of companies.<BR><BR>The peer group for purposes of PSUs is comprised of a select sample of comparably-sized, publicly traded North American chemical and fertilizer companies.  See &#147;Basis for Compensation Dec
isions - Peer Groups&#148; (below) for details with respect to the PSU Peer Group.<BR><BR>See <B>Schedule &#147;E&#148; </B>for a detailed description of the PSU Plan.</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Motivate and Reward<BR>
    <BR>
    Align executive and Shareholder interests
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Encourages medium-term growth by linking portion of compensation
    to medium-term company performance.<BR>
    <BR>
    Vesting of PSUs is linked to the achievement of Shareholder
    return objectives over future performance periods.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1pt">

</TD>

</DIV>

    <TD align="left">
    The compensation plans discussed in the above table are those
    plans which apply to senior executives of Agrium. Please note
    that Agrium has additional compensation plans in place which are
    designed to motivate and reward non-executive employee groups.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Illustration
    of Compensation Mix</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Agrium&#146;s executive compensation program is designed to
    inspire our executives to strive for superior performance and to
    ensure that a greater percentage of compensation is performance
    based (or &#147;at-risk&#148;) for executives who bear higher
    levels of responsibility. The following table shows the target
    compensation mix for 2008:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="48%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=lead -->
    <TD width="4%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="4%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=lead -->
    <TD width="10%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="4%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=lead -->
    <TD width="5%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="4%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=05 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=05 type=lead -->
    <TD width="3%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=05 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=05 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="4%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=06 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=06 type=lead -->
    <TD width="2%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=06 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=06 type=hang1 -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom" align="center">
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>

    At-Risk pay for the CEO and the other NEOs:

    <BR>
