<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Defined
    benefit plans</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    With the exception of Mr.&#160;Gearheard, the NEOs are members
    of the Canadian DB SERP. Mr.&#160;Gearheard is a member of the
    U.S.&#160;DB SERP which is substantially similar in all respects
    to the Canadian DB SERP.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Under the Canadian DB SERP and the U.S.&#160;DB SERP, designated
    executives receive a pension of 2% of the average of the three
    highest consecutive years of excess earnings (&#147;<B>Excess
    Earnings</B>&#148;) multiplied by years of service as a
    designated executive. Excess Earnings is equal to the sum of
    base salary above the DC Plan Earnings Limit plus the actual
    incentive paid in respect of the year (including incentives
    under the Profit Sharing Plan and the Performance Recognition
    Plan), up to a maximum of the executive&#146;s target incentive
    level for the year. Excess Earnings are capped at
    U.S.$0.9&#160;million ($1&#160;million in Canadian currency) for
    designated executives and U.S.$2.3&#160;million for the CEO.
    Although both the Canadian DB SERP and U.S.&#160;DB SERP permit
    the granting of extra years of credited service, it is
    Agrium&#146;s general practice not to credit executives with
    additional years of service. However, upon termination of an
    executive&#146;s employment without cause or constructive
    dismissal of an executive, he or she may be credited with
    additional year(s) of service pursuant to the terms of
    employment related agreements between the Corporation and
    executives. Please see &#147;NEO Contracts&#148; (below) for
    details of the executive employment agreements.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The overall amount of pension payable under the Canadian DB SERP
    and U.S.&#160;DB SERP is limited to 70% of final Excess
    Earnings. Normal retirement age is 60&#160;years. Early
    retirement benefits are available from age&#160;55 with the
    pension reduced by 6% for each year retirement precedes normal
    retirement age. Postponed retirement benefits are available from
    age&#160;60 with the pension increased by 6% for each year of
    retirement that occurs after normal retirement age. The
    retirement pension is paid for life, with a spousal survivor
    pension of 60% of the executive&#146;s pension, or a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">15-year</FONT>
    guarantee for an executive without a spouse at retirement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Each of the NEOs were 50% vested under the Canadian DB SERP upon
    inception at June&#160;25, 2006. The remainder of their Canadian
    DB SERP entitlements vested at the rate of 25% over each of the
    following two years.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In addition to Canadian DB SERP amounts, pursuant to
    Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s employment contract, a commitment has
    been made to provide a minimum rate of return on assets
    transferred from the pension programs of Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s
    prior employer, which reflects an average return on a third
    party balanced investment fund in the five years preceding the
    commencement of Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s employment with the
    Corporation. See &#147;NEO Contracts&#148; (below) for details
    of Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s employment contract.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    For Mr.&#160;Gearheard&#146;s service before January&#160;1,
    2008, the determination of Excess Earnings under the
    U.S.&#160;DB SERP was modified to reflect the earnings limit
    applicable to the U.S.&#160;Basic Plan under the
    U.S.&#160;Internal Revenue Code, which was $225,000 in 2007.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    67
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Fifteen designated executives of the Corporation are
    participating in the unfunded Canadian DB SERP or the
    U.S.&#160;DB SERP. The total accrued pension obligation for the
    Canadian DB SERP and the U.S.&#160;DB SERP included in our
    December&#160;31, 2008 financial statements was $19,238,000. As
    these benefits are not pre-funded through a trust, benefits are
    paid from the general revenues of the Corporation. The Canadian
    DB SERP benefits for all Canadian participants who are not also
    U.S.&#160;taxpayers are secured by a Letter of Credit. The cost
    to secure the Letter of Credit was $201,000 in 2008.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The table below presents the projected annual retirement
    benefits (related to the defined benefit plan components of the
    retirement program) payable to NEOs at year end and upon normal
    retirement. In addition, the total defined benefit accrued
    pension obligation for each NEO is shown along with the changes
    to the obligation in 2008:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TR style="font-size: 7pt" valign="bottom" align="center">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=455 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>Notes:</B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"><!-- TABLE 06 -->

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">None of the NEOs have been credited
    with additional years of service above the years of service
    actually provided to the Corporation.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The normal retirement age for NEOs
    is 60. As discussed under &#147;Pension Benefits&#148; (above),
    in order to participate in the Canadian DB SERP or U.S. DB SERP,
    as applicable, designated executives entered into agreements
    with the Corporation phasing out any severance benefits by the
    age of 60.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(3)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The projected annual pension
    benefits are calculated assuming the highest average Excess
    Earnings remain unchanged from December&#160;31, 2008.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(4)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The accrued pension obligations are
    the actuarial value of projected benefits for service accrued to
    the date indicated. The calculation of the amounts shown in the
    table use actuarial assumptions and methods that are consistent
    with those used for calculating pension obligations disclosed in
    the Corporation&#146;s consolidated financial statements as of
    the date indicated. With the exception of amounts applicable to
    Mr.&#160;Gearheard, the conversion rate used was U.S.$1.00 =
    Cdn. $0.9881 and $1.2246 for December&#160;31, 2007 and
    December&#160;31, 2008, respectively.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(5)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The amount related to service cost,
    compensation changes differing from the assumptions (as utilized
    for purposes of calculating pension obligations as disclosed in
    the Corporation&#146;s consolidated financial statements), and
    the impact of freezing the registered U.S. Basic Plan benefit
    for Mr.&#160;Gearheard as at January&#160;1, 2008.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(6)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The amount related to items such as
    interest on the obligation, the impact of changes in the
    discount rate assumption and changes in the U.S. exchange rate
    for Canadian executives.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(7)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The accrued pension obligation
    disclosed for Mr.&#160;Wilson includes all components of his
    retirement program as described under &#147;NEO Contracts&#148;
    (below).
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<DIV style="width: 90%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<A name='155'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NEO
    Contracts</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Agrium entered into an employment agreement with its CEO,
    Michael M. Wilson. The key terms of the employment agreement are
    as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 9pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"><!-- TABLE 01 -->
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="21%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterleft -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="77%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -9pt; margin-left: 9pt">
    <B>Officer</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    Michael M. Wilson, President&#160;&#038; CEO
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="4" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -9pt; margin-left: 9pt">
    <B>Agreement Type</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Executive employment agreement
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="4" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -9pt; margin-left: 9pt">
    <B>Effective Date</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    October&#160;1, 2003, being the date of Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s
    appointment as President&#160;&#038; CEO of Agrium.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="4" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -9pt; margin-left: 9pt">
    <B>Expiry Date</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The agreement expires on May&#160;13, 2011 unless terminated
    earlier in accordance with its terms.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;

<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>

&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -9pt; margin-left: 9pt">
    <B>Base Salary</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Initially Cdn.$910,000 and currently Cdn.$1,275,000.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 12pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Mr.&#160;Wilson is eligible to receive a base salary of not less
    than the 50th&#160;percentile of the salaries paid to chief
    executive officers of an identified U.S. peer group. The
    identified U.S. peer group will be adjusted and updated at the
    discretion of the HR&#038;C Committee. See &#147;2008
    Compensation Discussion&#160;&#038; Analysis&#160;- Basis for
    Compensation Decisions&#160;- Peer Group&#148; for a discussion
    of the current U.S. Peer Group
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 12pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The Board retains the discretion to adjust
    Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s salary below the 50th&#160;percentile of
    the U.S. Peer Group based on overall financial performance of
    the Corporation, provided that similar downward adjustments are
    made to all senior officers of the Corporation.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="4" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Short-term and<BR>
    Long-term incentive<BR>
    Plan and Security<BR>
    Based Compensation<BR>
    Participation</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s employment agreement allows him to
    participate in:<BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Annual
    Incentives. The target level for Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s annual
    incentive shall be equal to the <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;50th&#160;percentile
    of incentive bonuses paid to chief executive officers of the
    U.S. Peer Group. The <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;actual
    bonus received by Mr.&#160;Wilson shall be determined in
    accordance with terms of applicable <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;incentive
    plans.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -4pt; margin-left: 4pt">
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Long-Term
    Incentives. The target level for Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s
    long-term incentive compensation, <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;including
    stock options and PSUs, shall be equal to the
    50th&#160;percentile of equity compensation <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;paid to
    chief executive officers of the U.S. Peer Group.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -4pt; margin-left: 4pt">
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Other
    Incentives. Mr.&#160;Wilson may, at the Board&#146;s discretion,
    be entitled to participate in <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;compensation
    plans or perks that are introduced from time to time for senior
    executives.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="4" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">

    Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s employment with the Corporation.

<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>Termination of<BR>
    Employment without<BR>
    cause and<BR>
    Constructive<BR>
    Dismissal and<BR>
    Change of Control</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
In the event that Mr.&#160;Wilson:<BR><BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
(i)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;is terminated by the Corporation without cause,<BR><BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -27pt; margin-left: 27pt;">
(ii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;terminates his employment after the occurrence of an event of Constructive Dismissal<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">(1)</SUP>, or<BR>

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -34pt; margin-left: 34pt;">
(iii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;is terminated or constructively dismissed for any reason other than disability, death or just <BR>cause within two years of a Change of Control<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">(2)</SUP> of the Corporation,

</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 9pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
Mr.&#160;Wilson would be entitled to receive a payment equal to his then monthly base salary multiplied by 36&#160;months; his target annual and long-term incentives for the current year prorated to the date of termination plus three times his target annual and long-term incentives for the current year; three times the annual cost of his perks; the cost of providing short and long-term disability and other health and welfare benefits that cannot be continued after the date of termination for a period of 36&#160;months, with the remainder of his health and welfare benefits being continued for a period of 36&#160;months; and credit for an additional three years of age and service for purposes of calculating his pension under the DC Plan and Canadian DB SERP or any other pension plan and supplemental plan in which he participates; provided that if Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s employment is terminated for any reason referred to in clauses(i), (ii)&#160;or (iii)&#160;above within three years of the expiry date of May&#
160;13, 2011, the Corporation shall only be liable to pay a prorated amount based on the number of months remaining from the termination date to the expiry date of May&#160;13, 2011.<BR><BR>In addition, Mr.&#160;Wilson would be entitled to:</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -4pt; margin-left: 4pt">
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;job
    relocation counselling services, tax and legal advice at a cost
    to the Corporation not to exceed <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;$10,000.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -4pt; margin-left: 4pt">
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;the
    transfer to him of any shares or debentures in the name of the
    Corporation for membership in <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;any clubs
    or organizations that were designated for the regular use of the
    CEO.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -4pt; margin-left: 4pt">
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;payment
    of all outstanding and accrued regular and special vacation pay.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;

<TD>

    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;payment
    of all legal fees and expenses that he may reasonably incur as a
    result of any contesting <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;of the
    validity or enforceability of or his liability under any
    provision of the agreement or as a <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;result of
    action taken by him in good faith to enforce his rights
    (provided that he is substantially <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;successful)
    together with interest thereon.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 12pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;

<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Securities held by Mr.&#160;Wilson which are convertible or
    exchangeable into securities or shares of the Corporation that
    are not then exercisable (&#147;<B>Unexercised
    Rights</B>&#148;), shall be accelerated so that the Unexercised
    Rights shall become immediately exercisable and shall remain
    exercisable for a period of four years following the date of
    notification of his termination or the expiry of such securities
    (whichever occurs first). All PSUs held by Mr.&#160;Wilson shall
    vest immediately and Mr.&#160;Wilson shall be paid the market
    value of such PSUs as at the date of termination.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="4" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -9pt; margin-left: 9pt">
    <B>Disability</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    In the event of termination due to a disability, Mr.&#160;Wilson
    is entitled to receive, until age&#160;60, a monthly payment
    equal to 70% of his monthly base salary at the date of
    termination, less the amount of any disability insurance
    payments received by him. In addition, Mr.&#160;Wilson shall
    receive payment of all amounts earned or accrued to the date of
    termination, including all PSUs earned or vested as of the date
    of termination. All securities held by Mr.&#160;Wilson which are
    convertible or exchangeable into securities or shares of the
    Corporation that are not then exercisable (&#147;<B>Unexercised
    Rights</B>&#148;), shall be accelerated so that the Unexercised
    Rights shall become immediately exercisable and shall remain
    exercisable for a period of four years following the date of
    notification of his termination or the expiry of such securities
    (whichever occurs first). All PSUs held by him shall vest
    immediately and he shall be paid the market value of such PSUs
    as at the date of termination.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="4" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Death</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    In the event of Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s death and if the amount
    of the life insurance then in place on Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s
    life is less than two times his annual base salary at the date
    of death, the Corporation shall pay to Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s
    estate an amount equal to the shortfall. In addition,
    Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s estate shall receive payment of all
    amounts earned or accrued to the date of termination, including
    all options and PSUs earned or vested (in accordance with the
    terms of the applicable plan) as of the date of termination.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="4" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Termination for<BR>
    cause</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    In the event of the termination of Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s
    employment for cause, payments are limited to the payment of all
    amounts earned or accrued to the date of termination, including
    all options and PSUs earned or vested (in accordance with the
    terms of the applicable plan) as of the date of termination.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="4" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Resignation</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Mr.&#160;Wilson is required to provide 60&#160;days&#146; prior
    written notice of his resignation and will receive payment of
    all amounts earned or accrued to the date of resignation,
    including all options and PSUs earned or vested (in accordance
    with the terms of the applicable plan) as of the effective date
    of resignation.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="4" align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>

<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>Confidentiality,<BR>
    Non-solicitation<BR>
    and Non-competition</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    Mr.&#160;Wilson will be subject to post-employment covenants
    restricting his use and disclosure of proprietary information,
    and prohibiting post-employment competition and solicitation of
    employees for a period of one year following the termination of
    his employment. The covenant prohibiting post-employment
    competition does not apply if Mr.&#160;Wilson resigns or is
    terminated after May&#160;13, 2010.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="4" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;

<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Mr.&#160;Wilson agreed that within five years of the effective
    date of the employment agreement he would own a minimum of
    225,000 common shares and will maintain such ownership
    throughout the balance of the term of the agreement. PSUs
    granted to Mr.&#160;Wilson shall count towards this ownership
    requirement.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="4" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>

&nbsp;

    The HR&#038;C Committee is required to complete an annual
    written performance evaluation of Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s
    performance as the CEO and to meet with him to discuss his
    performance.
</TD>

&nbsp;
</TD>

    The HR&#038;C Committee is required to meet prior to April of
    each year to establish(i)&#160;Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s salary for
    the current year, (ii)&#160;the amount of any incentive bonus
    for the previous calendar year, and (iii)&#160;the number of
    options, PSUs and other long-term incentives to be awarded for
    the current year.
</TD>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Notes:</FONT></B>
</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">&#147;<B>Constructive
    Dismissal</B>&#148; means (a)&#160;the assignment of any duties
    materially inconsistent with the CEOs position duties,
    responsibilities and status with the Corporation, (b)&#160;a
    reduction in the CEO salary without consent, except where such
    reduction or change is applicable to senior officers generally,
    (c)&#160;the failure of the Corporation to continue any benefit,
    bonus or other profit sharing compensation plan that the CEO is
    entitled to participate in, unless such change is applicable to
    senior officers generally, (d)&#160;the relocation of the CEO to
    any place other than the location at which he performed his
    duties immediately prior there to, except for required travel on
    the Corporation&#146;s business to an extent substantially
    consistent with the CEO&#146;s position and duties, (e)&#160;any
    other change that would constitute a constructive dismissal at
    law, (f)&#160;following a Change of Control, if the Company
    fails within ninety days to respond to a written request of the
    executive to provide an effective assumption of its obligation
    under the employment agreement.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">&#147;<B>Change of
    Control</B>&#148; means a change in the legal or effective
    control of the Corporation, the creation of a control block or
    the coming into existence of a controlling party, in any manner
    whatsoever, whether as a result of, or in connection with, a
    take-over bid, amalgamation, arrangement, merger, other form of
    business combination, asset disposition, contested election of
    directors, or any combination of the foregoing transactions, or
    otherwise, and without limiting the foregoing, a change of
    control shall conclusively be deemed to have occurred upon the
    occurrence of any of the following events: (a)&#160;any
    acquisition (direct or indirect) of securities of the
    Corporation, amalgamation, arrangement, merger or other business
    combination or transaction which results in a person or group
    becoming a control block of the Corporation such that the person
    or group exercises control over 25% or more of the votes
    attaching to all voting securities of the Corporation;
    (b)&#160;the sale, transfer or other disposition, in a single or
    series of transactions, of (i)&#160;assets of the Corporation
    having market value equal to 50% of the market value of the
    Corporation or (ii)&#160;assets comprising all or substantially
    all of a business segment or division of the Corporation (but
    only with respect to the executives responsible for such
    business segment or division); (c)&#160;any amalgamation,
    arrangement, merger, reorganization, other business combination
    or any other transaction unless those persons who were
    shareholders of the Corporation immediately prior to the
    implementation of such transaction own at least 60% of the
    shares or other equity interests in the Corporation or any
    resulting entity; (d)&#160;a change in the composition of the
    Board as a result of a contested election of directors, with the
    result that the persons who were directors of the Corporation
    prior to such contested election do not constitute a majority of
    the directors elected; or (e)&#160;the Board adopts a resolution
    to the effect that, for the purposes of the employment
    agreement, a change of control has occurred or is imminent.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In 2006, Agrium reviewed and amended its retirement plans and
    severance compensation practices. In connection with such
    amendments, Agrium&#146;s senior executives (with the exception
    of Michael M. Wilson whose employment is governed by an
    employment agreement as described above) entered into Executive
    Supplemental Pension, Change of Control and Severance
    Compensation Agreements. The key terms are as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="width: 90%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 9pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->

    <TD width="20%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterleft -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="78%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>Termination or<BR>
    Constructive<BR>
    Dismissal</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
In the event that an officer:<BR><BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
(i)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;is terminated by the Corporation without cause, or<BR><BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -24pt; margin-left: 24pt;">
(ii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;terminates his or her employment after the occurrence of an event of constructive dismissal<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">(1)</SUP>

</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 9pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    the officer will be entitled to payment of all amounts earned or
    accrued by the officer to the date of termination, plus payment
    of compensation equal to 1/12 of his or her base salary, target
    annual incentives, monthly benefits, perks and 1/12 of all
    pension contributions that would have been paid by Agrium,
    multiplied by the lesser of 24&#160;months or the number of
    months remaining from the termination date to the attainment of
    age&#160;60 (the &#147;<B>Termination Period</B>&#148;).
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 9pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    In addition, the officer will receive(i)&#160;additional
    credited service equal to the length of the Termination Period
    under the Canadian DB SERP or U.S. DB SERP (as applicable),
    (ii)&#160;a cash amount equal to the market value of the
    officer&#146;s vested PSUs determined as of the termination
    date, on the basis that all of the PSUs in the officer&#146;s
    PSU account shall be considered to be vested as of such date.
    The executive shall not be entitled to be granted any additional
    PSUs for the Termination Period. The vesting and expiry of any
    SARs held by the officer shall be determined by the SARs plan
    and the officer will not be entitled to additional SARs for the
    Termination Period. The vesting and expiry of options and tandem
    SARs shall be determined by the Stock Option Plan and the
    officer will not be entitled to any grants of SARs for the
    Termination Period. In addition, the officer will be entitled to
    career counselling services for a period of up to six months
    following the termination date.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="4" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Termination  or<BR>
    Constructive<BR>
    Dismissal after a<BR>
    Change of Control</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
If within two years of a change of ownership or control<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">(2)</SUP>:<BR><BR>

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -21pt; margin-left: 21pt;">
(i)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;the Corporation terminates an officer&#146;s employment without cause, or<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -27pt; margin-left: 27pt;">
(ii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;an officer is constructively dismissed,<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
the officer will be entitled to the compensation amounts identified under Termination or Constructive Dismissal (above) for the Termination Period. In addition to the above compensation,<BR><BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -27pt; margin-left: 27pt;">
(a)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;all outstanding unexercised SARs, stock options, tandem SARs held by the officer shall immediately become exercisable, and<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -27pt; margin-left: 27pt;">
(b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Agrium shall indemnify and save the executive harmless from all liability, damages, costs, etc. reasonably incurred by the executive in connection with an action to enforce or interpret the agreement and shall reimburse the executive for all costs.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="4" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -9pt; margin-left: 9pt">
    <B>Termination for Cause</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Payments are limited to all amounts earned or accrued to the
    date of termination, including all options and PSUs earned or
    vested (in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan) as
    of the date of termination.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="4" align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 10%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=492 length=54 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Notes:</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">&#147;<B>Constructive
    Dismissal</B>&#148; means (a)&#160;a material change in the
    title, position, responsibilities, duties, powers or reporting
    relationships of the executive, (b)&#160;a reduction in the
    annual base salary of the executive, (c)&#160;a requirement that
    the executive relocate to another city, province, state or
    country in order to maintain his or her employment, (d)&#160;any
    material reduction in the value of the benefit plans and target
    value of incentive programs, (e)&#160;the failure of the
    Corporation to obtain, following a change of control or receipt
    of a written request of the executive, an assumption of
    continuing obligations under the employment agreement by any
    successor of the Corporation, (f)&#160;any other changes that
    would constitute constructive dismissal at law.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">&#147;<B>Change of
    Control</B>&#148; has the same meaning as set for under the
    employment agreement between the Corporation and Mr.&#160;Wilson
    as discussed above.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    72
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<A name='156'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Termination
    and Change of Control Benefits</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 4pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Agrium does not view change of control or post-termination
    benefits as additional elements of compensation due to the fact
    that a change of control or other triggering event may never
    occur. However, the use and structure of Agrium&#146;s
    termination and change of control benefits are consistent with
    Agrium&#146;s compensation objectives to attract and retain
    talented executives. In addition, Agrium believes that change of
    control provisions encourage continued productivity and
    retention of top executives in the face of the possible
    disruptive impact of an actual or potential change of control.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 4pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Upon termination of employment, the NEOs may be eligible for
    certain benefits and payments. The following table summarizes
    the applicable payments and benefits available under the
    Corporation&#146;s equity compensation plans (as described in
    detail in <B>Schedule &#147;E&#148;</B>) and NEO contracts (as
    described under &#147;NEO Contracts&#148; (above)):
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 4pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">

</TD>

<TR style="font-size: 7pt" valign="bottom" align="center">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>Dismissal and<BR>
    </B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>Control with no<BR>
    </B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">

<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">

<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">

<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">

    <B>a Change of Control</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>Event</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>Retirement</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>Disability</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    <B>Death</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -7pt; margin-left: 7pt">
    <B>Salary/ Severance</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    NEOs are entitled to a payment equal to monthly base salary for
    the Severance
    Period.<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">(1)</SUP>

</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    N/A
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    N/A
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    CEO is entitled to receive until the age of 60 a payment equal
    to 70% of his monthly base salary, less the amount of any
    disability insurance payment received by him.
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    The CEO&#146;s estate is entitled to receive the difference
    between (i) 2 times the CEO&#146;s base salary, and (ii) the
    CEO&#146;s existing life insurance coverage.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -7pt; margin-left: 7pt">
    <B>Benefits and Perks</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
NEOs are entitled to payment equal to benefits and perks for the Severance Period.<BR><BR>NEOs are entitled to post-termination benefits.<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">(2)</SUP>

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>

</TD>

&nbsp;
</TD>

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    NEOs are eligible to receive post-retirement
    benefits.<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">(3)</SUP>

</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">

</DIV>

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -7pt; margin-left: 7pt">
    <B>Options, SARs and PSUs</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
CEO is entitled to a payment equal to his target level long-term incentives for the Severance Period.<BR><BR>Any unvested stock options and SARs held by an NEO shall immediately become exercisable and all PSUs held shall immediately vest and such NEO shall be paid the market value of such PSUs as at the date of termination.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    All unvested stock options and SARs held by NEOs immediately
    become exercisable.
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    All NEOs shall be entitled to payment equal to the amount to
    which the NEO would have been entitled if he or she continued
    employment throughout the performance period of any unvested
    PSUs.<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">(4)</SUP>

</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
All unvested stock options and SARs held by the CEO shall immediately become exercisable and all PSUs held by the CEO shall vest immediately and be paid out at the market value of such PSUs as at the date of termination.<BR><BR>The other NEOs shall be entitled to payment equal to the amount to which the NEO would have been entitled if he or she continued employment throughout the performance period of any unvested PSUs.<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">(4)</SUP></DIV>

</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
All unvested options and SARs held by the NEOs shall become immediately exercisable.<BR><BR>All vested PSUs held by the NEOs will be treated as vested, and NEOs&#146; beneficiaries shall be entitled to cash payment equal to the market value of the PSUs as at the date of death.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">

    pension plans for the Severance Period.

    plans.<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">(5)</SUP>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=455 length=60 -->



<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Notes:</FONT></B>
</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The &#147;Severance Period&#148;
    is: (A)&#160;for the CEO the lesser of
    (i)&#160;three&#160;years, and (ii)&#160;the number of months
    remaining until the CEO reaches the age of 60; and (B)&#160;for
    the other NEOs the lesser of (i)&#160;two&#160;years, and
    (ii)&#160;the number of months remaining until the officer
    reaches the age of 60.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The CEO&#146;s post-termination
    benefits include six months of outplacement job relocation
    counselling, tax and legal advice to a maximum of $10,000. Other
    NEO&#146;s post-termination benefits include up to six months of
    outplacement career counselling services.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(3)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Post-retirement benefits available
    for NEOs are the same as those for all other eligible retirees
    at Agrium. Specifically, such benefits include extended heath
    care benefits and life insurance (which declines from 100% of
    pre-retirement basic life insurance up to age&#160;65 down to
    30% at age&#160;70 or older). The principal amount of
    Mr.&#160;Gearheard&#146;s post-retirement life insurance is
    $10,000.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(4)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Payments will be made at the end of
    the applicable performance period based on the Total Shareholder
    Return for the period.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(5)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">In addition, pursuant to his
    employment agreement the CEO is entitled to a minimum rate of
    return on assets transferred from the pension programs of the
    CEO&#146;s prior employer.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    73
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

    The following table sets out estimates of the incremental
    amounts payable to each NEO upon identified termination events,
    assuming each such event took place on December&#160;31, 2008:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom" align="center">
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="2" nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>Termination<BR>
    </B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="2" nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="2" nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="2" nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom" align="center">
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="2" nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>Without<BR>
    </B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="2" nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">

    <BR>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=455 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Notes:</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">There are no incremental payments
    payable to Agrium executives (including the NEOs) in the case of
    voluntary resignation or termination for cause. In the event of
    an executive&#146;s death or disability, he or she will be
    entitled to the payments as described under &#147;Termination
    and Change of Control Benefits&#148; on page&#160;73.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The table identifies the
    incremental amounts payable on the acceleration of vesting of
    options, SARs and PSUs in the identified circumstances and does
    not include the value of outstanding equity awards that have
    previously vested or the value of option grants that will vest
    in accordance with the terms of the original grant. See
    &#147;Incentive Plan Awards&#148; (above) for details regarding
    all outstanding stock options and PSU awards.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(3)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Value of PSUs is the estimated
    current value based on December&#160;31, 2008&#160;share price
    of $34.13 and assumed target level performance resulting in
    payout of 100% of target. Actual incremental PSU payments may
    vary and will depend upon share price and actual performance at
    the time of payout.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(4)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The PSU plan does not permit the
    early vesting of PSUs in the event of change of control without
    concurrent NEO termination. As a result, no incremental payments
    have been attributed to PSUs under this scenario.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(5)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The table does not include the
    value of pension benefits that have previously accrued to NEOs,
    which benefits are set out under &#147;Pension Plan
    Benefits&#148; (above). Upon retirement unvested PSUs will not
    be cancelled, instead NEOs will be entitled to the value of
    unvested PSUs that the NEO would have been entitled if he or she
    continued employment throughout the performance period. Actual
    payouts upon vesting of these awards have been estimated based
    on Agrium&#146;s share price of U.S.$34.13 on December&#160;31,
    2008, target level performance and assuming that each executive
    has reached Agrium&#146;s normal retirement age of 60 as at
    December&#160;31, 2008. Upon retirement unvested stock options
    will expire in accordance with the terms of their grant. Given
    that no accelerated vesting is contemplated on the occurrence of
    retirement, no incremental payments are payable to NEOs pursuant
    to the Stock Option Plan. The value of unvested stock options is
    set out under &#147;Incentive Plan Awards&#148; (above).
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    For descriptions of the agreements pursuant to which termination
    and change of control benefits are payable, including
    descriptions of triggering circumstances, calculation of payment
    amounts and post-employment restrictive covenants see &#147;NEO
    Contracts&#148; (above). See <B>Schedule &#147;E&#148; </B>for a
    description of the Corporation&#146;s equity compensation plans,
    including details regarding the expiry and early vesting of
    awards upon the occurrence of identified events.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    It is the general practice of the HR&#038;C Committee to
    periodically request and review a report (i)&#160;describing
    trends in termination and change of control provisions,
    (ii)&#160;reviewing provisions applicable to Agrium&#146;s
    senior executives under employment agreements and
    (iii)&#160;quantifying potential incremental and aggregate
    payments to each of the NEOs that may arise under various
    termination and share price scenarios, including normal
    retirement, resignation, termination for cause, termination
    without cause and change of control termination. The HR&#038;C
    Committee last undertook this comprehensive review in 2007.
</DIV>
<A name='157'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">SECTION&#160;FIVE:
    GENERAL INFORMATION</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>

<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>
<A name='158'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">INDEBTEDNESS
    OF DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS</FONT></U></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Except for routine indebtedness, none of our directors and
    executive officers or any of their associates is or has been
    indebted to us or any of our subsidiaries at any time during
    2008. No indebtedness has been extended, renewed or has had its
    terms modified since July&#160;29, 2002.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    75
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<A name='159'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">INTEREST
    OF CERTAIN PERSONS AND COMPANIES IN MATTERS TO BE ACTED
    UPON</FONT></U></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    We are not aware of any material interest of any director,
    officer, any person beneficially owing or exercising control or
    direction over 10% or more of our Common Shares, or any
    associate or affiliate of any of them, in any transaction since
    January&#160;1, 2008 or any proposed transaction that has
    materially affected or will materially affect the Corporation or
    our affiliates.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<A name='160'>
<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">DIRECTORS&#146;
    AND OFFICERS&#146; INSURANCE</FONT></U></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    We carry directors&#146; and officers&#146; liability insurance
    covering acts and omissions of our directors and officers and
    those of our subsidiaries. The policy has a covering limit of
    U.S.$100,000,000 in each policy year. The total premiums paid by
    the Corporation in 2008 were U.S.$928,175. The corporate policy
    provides for the Corporation to absorb a deductible amount of up
    to U.S.$2,000,000 on securities claims and $1,000,000 on all
    other claims.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Our by-laws provide for the indemnification of each director and
    officer against all costs, charges and expenses reasonably
    incurred by the director in respect of any action or proceeding
    to which the director is made a party by reason of being a
    director or officer of the Corporation, subject to limitations
    contained in our by-laws or the Act. We also have agreements
    with each director and officer to provide indemnification to the
    extent permitted under the&#160;Act.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<A name='161'>
<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">SHAREHOLDER
    PROPOSALS</FONT></U></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Shareholder proposals to be considered for inclusion in the 2010
    Management Proxy Circular must be received by us on or before
    December&#160;22, 2009.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<A name='162'>
<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">ADDITIONAL
    INFORMATION AND OTHER DOCUMENTS</FONT></U></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Financial information is provided in our comparative financial
    statements and management&#146;s discussion and analysis for our
    most recently completed financial year.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Additional information relating to the Corporation is available
    on the SEDAR web site at www.sedar.com. Any shareholder wishing
    to receive a copy of this Circular, the Annual Report (including
    our consolidated annual financial statements and
    Management&#146;s Discussion&#160;&#038; Analysis for the
    Corporation&#146;s most recently completed financial year) and
    our Annual Information Form may do so free of charge by
    contacting our Corporate Secretary at 13131 Lake Fraser Drive
    S.E., Calgary, Alberta, Canada T2J 7E8 or by telephone at
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">(403)&#160;225-7000.</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<A name='163'>
<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">OTHER
    MATTERS</FONT></U></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of March&#160;23, 2009, we know of no amendment, variation or
    other matter to come before the Meeting other than the matters
    referred to above.
</DIV>

    Circular.
</DIV>

    Named Executive Officers, being the CEO, CFO and the other three
    most highly compensated executive officers of the Corporation
</TD>

<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    UAP Holding Corp.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;

<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">

</TD>

<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">

    &#160;<B>U.S. Code</B>
</DIV>

    amended</I>
</TD>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">SCHEDULE
    &#147;B&#148;</FONT></B>

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">CORPORATE
